questiontext.text:
Which statement(s) is/are correct?

I. The standard normal distribution is never symmetrical.

  1. Â With a normally distributed variable, 2.5% of the observations are at least 1.96 times the standard deviation above the average.

generalfeedback.text:
The standard normal distribution is symmetrical. (so I is incorrect) and II is correct.
With a normally distributed variable, 2.5% of the observations are at least 1.96 times the standard deviation above the average.

Levels of Difficulty

answer.text: Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
Statement I and statement II are incorrect.
Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
Statement I and statement II are correct.
